intro: Vandellia subcrenulata, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant produces heart-shaped leaves with a slightly wavy margin, and its vines can climb or trail along rocky surfaces. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
